page.title: 10Hillside Church
page.content: Hillside Kirk is a roofless stone building. It was used until 1963 when it's few remaining members united with the Church of Scotland. As well as being an imposing building, it has an interesting history. In 1843,many ministers expressed discontent at the General Assembly over the way that ministers were being appointed by the local laord through patronage. As a result Rev. Ingram, then minister at St. John's Church at Baliasta, broke away,along with 1054 of the total 1160 established church members. The Free Church was built at Hillside on land owned by the Ingrams. It's building took a mere 6 months and was mostly free labour . Meanwhile, the new congregation met under canvas.During the first sevice at the Kirk, the tarpaulin blew away.
